content: What is the expected URI to use for ICD-10 CM? http://build.fhir.org/terminologies-systems.html listed a specific one for IDC-9 but doesn't have one called out for 10
We had assumed it would be http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/icd-10-cm
I think it's http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/icd-10-us. @Rob Hausam that's what we said, yes?

it has been icd-10-us, but in GF#9033 (no vote recorded yet) it's suggesting icd-10-cm, which is consistent with our last discussion:

[11/3/16, 9:09:19 PM] Grahame Grieve: is ICD-10-us = ICD-10-cm?
[11/3/16, 9:23:52 PM] Rob Hausam: yes - ICD-10-CM is the official name of the ICD-10 modification used in the US
I thought that calling it icd-10-us could be confusing, but it's also more descriptive of what it actually is
if we use both, it definitely needs to be clear that they are synonymous

yes - once I'm able to join the call at 4:00 PM, after my meeting ends
I think we should make it icd-10-cm, since that's the official name
Also want to verify the PCS URI since it links to a completely different place than the rest (ICD10data) http://www.icd10data.com/icd10pcs
yes that's deliberate. I really think that they shouldn't have been allowed to call that one icd10 at all. but they did, so we follow them
confirming, after going through the tasks last night, that the correct URI is http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/icd-10-cm. I have updated the documentation
